title: Child Care Affordability and Subsidies in Timor-Leste

questions.question: What is the typical range for center-based child care costs per month in urban areas of Timor-Leste?
Which of the following is NOT a factor influencing cost differences between rural and urban child care in Timor-Leste?
choices: Higher operating costs in urban areas
Higher staff salaries in urban centers
Limited availability of formal care options in rural areas

questions.question: What is the income threshold for eligibility in Timor-Leste's income-based child care subsidy program?
What percentage of child care costs can be covered by the income-based subsidy program in Timor-Leste?
Which of the following is a challenge with current subsidy programs in Timor-Leste?
What percentage of startup costs can be covered by rural child care center grants in Timor-Leste?
Which of the following is NOT a common family strategy for dealing with high child care costs in Timor-Leste?
choices: Relying on extended family for care
Choosing lower-quality, more affordable care options
Increasing household income through additional employment
questions.answer: Increasing household income through additional employment

questions.question: What is a potential long-term consequence of high child care costs in Timor-Leste?
Which factor influences family decisions about child care in Timor-Leste?
choices: Number of shopping centers in the area

questions.question: What is the average percentage of income spent on child care in Timor-Leste?
How does Timor-Leste's average percentage of income spent on child care compare to the OECD average?
Which of the following countries has the lowest average percentage of income spent on child care, according to the comparative data provided?
What type of subsidy system does Timor-Leste currently use for child care?
Which group is given priority access in Timor-Leste's child care subsidy system?
What is a potential unintended consequence of expanding child care subsidies in Timor-Leste?
choices: Decreased demand for child care services
Potential compromise in quality if providers cut costs to keep fees low
questions.answer: Potential compromise in quality if providers cut costs to keep fees low

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a factor contributing to the overall cost of child care in Timor-Leste?
What is a potential impact of high child care costs on family planning in Timor-Leste?
Which of the following is a challenge in the current child care subsidy system in Timor-Leste?
What is a suggested improvement for the child care subsidy system in Timor-Leste?
choices: Reducing the number of eligible families
Increasing the complexity of the application process
Expanding outreach efforts to ensure all eligible families are aware of programs
questions.answer: Expanding outreach efforts to ensure all eligible families are aware of programs

questions.question: Which type of child care arrangement is often less expensive but potentially less reliable in Timor-Leste?
choices: Informal care by relatives or neighbors
questions.answer: Informal care by relatives or neighbors

questions.question: What is a potential economic impact of high child care costs on Timorese families?
choices: Reduced family income and economic stability
questions.answer: Reduced family income and economic stability

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a type of government subsidy for child care in Timor-Leste?
choices: Subsidies for center-based care in underserved areas
Universal free child care for all families
questions.answer: Universal free child care for all families

questions.question: What is a potential consequence of parents delaying their return to work due to high child care costs?
Which of the following is a recommendation for improving child care affordability in Timor-Leste?
choices: Reducing government involvement in child care
Increasing investment in early childhood education
Focusing solely on urban child care centers
questions.answer: Increasing investment in early childhood education

questions.question: What is the primary goal of the rural child care center grants in Timor-Leste?
choices: To encourage the establishment of formal child care centers in rural regions
To reduce the quality of rural child care
questions.answer: To encourage the establishment of formal child care centers in rural regions

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a factor influencing family decisions about child care in Timor-Leste?
choices: Quality and accessibility of available care options

questions.question: What is a potential risk of focusing solely on affordability in child care policy?
choices: Increased demand for child care services
Quality may be compromised if providers cut costs to keep fees low
questions.answer: Quality may be compromised if providers cut costs to keep fees low

questions.question: Which of the following is a suggested component of a comprehensive national child care strategy for Timor-Leste?
choices: Addressing both urban and rural needs
questions.answer: Addressing both urban and rural needs

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of means-testing in Timor-Leste's child care subsidy system?
choices: To ensure only wealthy families receive subsidies
To determine eligibility based on family income
To promote private child care providers
questions.answer: To determine eligibility based on family income
